```{r }
library(ggplot2)
library(readr)
data <- read_csv("data/covid_19_data_cleaned.csv")
data
```


# For displying the data we use the str
```{r}
str(data)
```
# For removing the province/state
```{r}
library(plyr)
data <- ddply(data,.(Date, Country), numcolwise(sum))
```

# Remove the lattitude and longitude because we do not need these columns
```{r}
str(data)
data <- within(data, rm(Lat,Long))
str(data)
```

# Now select the data of US for plotting purpose
```{r}
us <- subset(data, Country=="US")
```

## Now show single data but one problem might some countries do not updated the latest data
```{r}
# now show single data but one problem might some countries do not updated the latest data
latest <- subset(data,Date==max(Date)-3)


```
# Top 10 most hitted Countries or affected by Covid-19

```{r}


latest <- latest[order(latest$Confirmed,decreasing = TRUE),]
top <- latest[1:10,]
top



```




# Plot using ggplot2
#Box Plot
```{r}


library(ggplot2)
ggplot(top,aes(x=Country,y=Confirmed))+
  geom_col(colors="red",fill="orange")+
  labs(title="Most top 10 Worst Hit Countries by Covid-19 for 2020 year",subtitle = "Covid-19 Dataset",caption = "Rukhsar Ahmed")

```
## Scatter plot
```{r}

us
 ggplot(us)+
  
  geom_point(aes(x=Date,y=Confirmed),size=2,colour="Red")+
 
  labs(title="Confirmed case of  Covid-19 for US ",subtitle = "Covid-19 Cases",caption = "Rukhsar Ahmed")

```
# Line plot
```{r}

us
 ggplot(us)+
  
  geom_point(data=us,aes(x=Date,y=Recovered),size=2,colour="Red")+
  geom_line(data=us,aes(x=Date,y=Deaths),size=2,colour="Yellow")+
 labs(title="Recovered and Deaths cases  of  Covid-19 for US ",subtitle = "Covid-19 Cases",caption = "Rukhsar Ahmed")


```
# Line plot for checking the death rate 

```{r}
us
 ggplot(us)+
  geom_line(data=us,aes(x=Date,y=Deaths),size=2,colour="Red")+
 labs(title="Total Deaths cases  of  Covid-19 for US ",subtitle = "Covid-19 Cases",caption = "Rukhsar Ahmed")

```
# Histogram with density 
```{r}
ggplot(top,aes(x=Deaths,fill=Country))+
  geom_histogram(bins=35,aes(y=stat(density)))+
  geom_density(colour="red")

```
